title: Florida defense leads way in defeat of No. 7 Auburn
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg provides his opinion of the top three programs in the history of college football. USA TODAY

GAINESVILLE, Fla. – For the longest time Saturday afternoon, it was hard to tell if Auburn vs. Florida was a struggle between dominant defenses or futile matchup of anemic offenses. The answer might have been: Both.

No. 8 Florida edged No. 7 Auburn in a bizarre, back-and-forth slugfest that defies easy description: four turnover by Florida, four by Auburn, and neither team able to seize clinching momentum – at least, until Lamical Perine’s 88-yard burst down the home sideline with just more than nine minutes left finally provided the Gators room to breathe.

With that, Florida advances to the next round of the little mini-tournament this month among Auburn, Florida and LSU. At 6-0, the Gators will meet unbeaten and No. 5 LSU next week in Baton Rouge.

Florida wide receiver Freddie Swain (16) makes a reception and runs the ball for a touchdown during the first quarter against the Auburn at Ben Hill Griffin Stadium. (Photo: Douglas DeFelice, USA TODAY Sports)

Here are three takeaways from Florida’s 24-13 win against Auburn:

- It’s a huge win for the Gators, obviously. And it came against perhaps the best defense they’ll face. But the offensive performance, while gutty, doesn’t inspire confidence that Florida can stick with LSU. Along with Perine’s long run, the Gators got an early touchdown on a 64-yard pass off a busted coverage. Florida had some success passing – credit quarterback Kyle Trask’s solid play, especially after returning after he’d suffered a minor knee injury – but hadn’t been able to sustain any drives. Against LSU, the Gators will need much more from the offense.

Before Perine’s touchdown run, the Gators had 27 rushing yards on 24 carries. That stat includes significant sack yardage, of course – but Florida hadn’t been able to run the ball much at all. Florida started from its 35 while clinging to a 17-13 lead. Perine broke a tackle from linebacker K.J. Britt just beyond the line of scrimmage, then another from safety Daniel Thomas near the 35, and then sped alone the rest of the way into the end zone.

WINNING UGLY: No. 18 Michigan gets needed defeat of No. 14 Iowa

DOMINANT LIONS: Penn State tops Purdue as Big Ten showdowns await

- Auburn freshman quarterback Bo Nix wasn’t ready for the moment, or at least not for the Gators’ defense. He was 11-26 for 145 yards, with three interceptions.

Nix has gotten credit this season for making plays, especially during two big wins against Oregon in a neutral-site game and at Texas A&M. He’s seemingly growing through the season. But in the Swamp, against the best defense he’s seen – and might see all season – Nix struggled.

Late in the third quarter, when Auburn’s running game finally got going, the Tigers moved from their 5 into position to score the go-ahead touchdown. But a long completion to a wide-open Seth Williams was actually overthrown, or Williams would have scored. Then Nix misfired badly on a slant. Moments later, Nix was intercepted in the end zone by free safety Donovan Stiner.

On Auburn’s next possession, Nix threw behind an open receiver. And on third-and-8, his scramble backward turned into a disastrous 22-yard loss, ending a promising drive.

He didn’t get much help. The Tigers had trouble running all day. At halftime, Auburn had 92 yards and two first downs. Nix was 5-of-14 for 57 yards, with an interception.

- The first half wasn’t great football, but it was rollicking good fun. Let’s recount the mistakes: Florida lost three fumbles. Auburn muffed a punt and Nix threw an interception.

Oh, and Florida tried an ill-advised fake punt from its own 34; punter Tommy Townsend took the snap and tried to run directly up the middle … for a loss of 2. Nix connected with Williams for a touchdown on the next play. But all of the mistakes were largely forced by two very good defenses.
description: Florida's defense forced four turnovers and made just enough offensive plays to beat Auburn in critical matchup of top 10 teams in the SEC.
